headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: CNN's New Year's Eve Live. Aired 7-8p ET

utterances.speaker: LAURA COATES, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: That was good. That was good.

utterances.speaker: ISA SOARES, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: More time with family is great. My mom --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh, its coming.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Mom and dad in Lisbon --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Home is coming. Okay. Our parents we love you.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: We love you, guys.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: All of our friends and family. And to everyone watching. Here it comes. Oh my gosh!

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: It's best. It's coming.(NEW YEAR'S COUNTDOWN) (CHEERS) (FIREWORKS DISPLAY) (MUSIC)

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh my God.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year. Wow.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: London --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: London -- I mean, London understood the assignment, everyone. This is incredible. It was unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Unbelievable. Unbelievable. Congratulations to Darryl Fleming, the director.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Twelve thousand.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Twelve thousand? SOARES

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I mean, honestly, I can tell you this. That did not do it justice.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: No, it does not.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Seeing it in person --

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: You feel your paw shaking.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: You did.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: You're watching wherever you may be, happy New Year to you.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: And to your loved ones.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh my gosh. What? I will never forget this night. It was magical to hear it all. I feel it.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: And the silence from the crowd and they taking it all in.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I know. I mean, and people over there are dancing. They're hugging around us. They're kissing. Auld Lang Syne was here.Look at this. The London eye.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Magical. A magical items right here.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Lighting the London skyline. And look at those crowds.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Boris, unbelievable, to watch it here, Boris. I mean, really, happy New Year, officially from London, Boris.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I love that song. That was so nice to hear. I know were all singing along, everyone. Weren't you out there in the crowd?Well, earlier, Madrid hit midnight and here is Pau Mosquera ringing in the brand New Year from the flamenco capital of the world. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) (FIREWORKS DISPLAY)

utterances.speaker: PAU MOSQUERA, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Again, happy New Year from Madrid, feliz ano nuevo.This is the way that we welcome 2025 in the country. And we did it as we told you before, in a very special way, with the 12 grapes of luck it in one place for each bell chime. Behind me, you can see all the people enjoying with friends, with their families. It's very exciting for all of them waiting that their dreams will come true for this year. Actually, I'm also wishing all of you that this 2025 will bring true peace and joy to you and to your family. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: A very special show there in Madrid, in Spain. I hope Paul survived eating those 12 grapes. Glad to see him doing well there.We want to take you now live to Copacabana Beach and Julia Jones. Julia, the party there, we hear, is really starting to pick up.

utterances.speaker: JULIA JONES, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: It is, Boris. You can see behind me. People are really getting into it at this hour. But I'm going to take you to the other side over here on this marvelous ocean.This is where a lot of Brazilians are coming at this hour to start doing a very important tradition of New Year's Eve, that is, to jump the seven waves. If you've ever been to Brazil on New Year's Eve, this is what you do. And it's not that easy at this hour, but I'm going to try. The trick is you got to make a wish and jump a little wave. Make a wish and jump a little wave. Okay, there's a good one coming. There's a good one coming. We're going to try for this. I'm going to cap that at two. But there's a bunch of other traditions that I want to share with you guys. One of them, its similar to what people do in Spain, which is you eat seven grapes -- seven green grapes and making a wish every time. I mean, if I keep on making wishes that I keep doing all of these, I think I'm going to be really lucky in 2025. This, of course, has to do with Brazil's multicultural background, cultural background, right? A lot of these earlier today, I threw flowers into the ocean for the goddess of the sea. That's something that comes from Brazil's African religions, that has kind of seeped into the general culture. And now everybody does it. The colors are really important. I'm wearing white. That's for peace. I'm wishing peace for the world in 2025. And then this one, I believe my producer is telling me this is for good luck, right. So I'm going to take a little bit. And money, money. So take a little bit of powder cinnamon. You make your wish and blow it into the air. The last wish that I'm going to make with you guys hear on this lovely glass. Not going to drink it. Don't worry. We're still working here tonight. You make a wish. SANCHEZ: That looks like an incredible time in Rio de Janeiro, in Copacabana Beach.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year, guys. Happy New Year from Rio.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year, Julia Jones. Thank you so much. Oh, wasted, wasted. I hope there's some caipirinha, some caipirinha in her future. Yeah. And I hope some of those folks that were trying to jump the waves succeeded. Some of them seem to get underwater very quickly.Julia Jones, thank you so much for that. Coming up, we have something truly special -- yeah, we have something truly special for you from Morgan Freeman's blues club in Mississippi. Omar Jimenez has been there all night hitting the keys. We should note with the band that's on stage. And, Omar, we have a huge name, a legend coming up soon.

utterances.speaker: OMAR JIMENEZ, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Yeah. And by the way, I got pressured to be on stage earlier by this guy right here, Morgan Freeman. You own the place. And I heard your voice. I didn't know if I could deny what you were asking me to do, but I hear right now we're actually making one of your dreams come true. What is it here?MORGAN FREEMAN, ACTOR/PRODUCER: I got to correct it here, Omar.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Correct me.

utterances.speaker: FREEMAN
utterances.sentences: One of my dreams come true. Yes, but it's about what I've been doing for years.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: FREEMAN
utterances.sentences: Can I admit that? Can I say what that is?

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: You can admit and say whatever it is, go for it.

utterances.speaker: FREEMAN
utterances.sentences: Okay. Every time I have a long drive, my car, I'm singing along with Al Green, his entire album. So, if you say bucket list in person --

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: FREEMAN
utterances.sentences: -- I'm just intimidated.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: All right, all right. We got Morgan Freeman and Al Green coming up on stage together.

utterances.speaker: FREEMAN
utterances.sentences: On stage.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: All right. In less than 30 minutes, Boris and I are going to hand over the New Year's Eve party reins to none other than Anderson Cooper and Andy Cohen in New York's Times Square. And if past years are any indication, it's going to be a wild ride.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, CNN HSOT
utterances.sentences: And happy New Year, everyone. We are live in Times Square.

utterances.speaker: ANDY COHEN, TV HOST
utterances.sentences: It's going to be a lot of fun.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm going to show you a quick juggle if I can.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Okay? Whoa, whoa!

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do not try that at home.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Yeah. No.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Not a good idea.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Carrot top is now beating Stephanie.

utterances.speaker: RICHARD QUEST, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Look at it. King of the world. I'm terrified of heights.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I like it here a lot. It seems like a fun vibe.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's about who you invite, really.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We have a lot to celebrate this year.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: What do they look like?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: We are going. Don't worry about it.Pickle juice.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I've never had a pickle.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: You've never had a pickle? What?Miss Patti Labelle, our Gemini twin.

utterances.speaker: PATTI LABELLE, SINGER
utterances.sentences: Hi, Anderson.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Wow.Katy Perry is joining us. Katy, welcome.

utterances.speaker: KATY PERRY, MUSICIAN
utterances.sentences: Hi, guys.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Neil Patrick Harris.

utterances.speaker: NEIL PATRICK HARRIS, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: Hey, Andy.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: Wow. Look at you.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.sentences: What's up, gentleman? How are you?

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: He is good.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Gina -- Gina King, we are such fans of yours.

utterances.speaker: GINA KING, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: Hey, you know I love you fellas. You know I do.

utterances.speaker: COHEN
utterances.sentences: In the bar, and there are cats everywhere.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's a cat bar. I mean, I don't know how much more clear I can be about the objective of this place.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That's perfect TV. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: You can expect many more moments just like those tonight.Yeah. Anderson and Andy are going to keep the party going in Times Square at the top of the hour, just about 20-ish minutes away. And speaking of Times Square, the excitement there is ramping up. As you might imagine. Let's check back with CNN's Coy Wire. Coy, what's it like there right now?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Okay, here we go.

utterances.speaker: REPORTER
utterances.sentences: Safest area of New York City. Really the country on this day. Tell me why?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Because there are so many --

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: All right, so I'm here with some of my new closest friends all the way from Japan.You guys know about Mamushi dance? Yeah, I know, all right, let's do this. Let's do this. Are you ready? (MUSIC) (CHEERS)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: He's a star. As everyone's here, were going to have a great time tonight. That ball is about to drop. And we're going to ring in this New Year right. Oh and I got a little fancy for y'all since you were giving me some, you know, stuff about it earlier. Oh, were going on here.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, wow. Coy Wire, you stay warm out there.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I think Coy has found his niche.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: And you clean up good in the tuxedo. That's a good one. I love it. Okay, here we go, Coy.Well, look, listen, more than a million people are going to jam in Times Square today, tonight, to ring in the New Year with Anderson and Andy. And as usual, the NYPD will have a massive presence. They spent months, literally months, preparing to make sure that tonight's celebration is safe and also secure. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: REPORTER
utterances.sentences: I love it when we say this is the safest area of New York City, really, the country on this day. Tell me why.REBECCA WEINER, NYPD DEPUTY COMMISSIONER OF INTELLIGENCE & COUNTERTERRORISM: Because there are so many officers who are here to protect all the crowds. Some you see, some you don't. All of our aerial resources, people on the ground. We have radiation, chem, bio detection equipment. We have our bomb sweeps, our canines, our heavy weapons teams. Everybody here to ensure that the night goes off without a hitch.

utterances.speaker: REPORTER
utterances.sentences: You bring out all the tools.

utterances.speaker: WEINER
utterances.sentences: We bring out all the tools. And then, of course, this is not something that we just do for this day. We've been not only doing the planning, but also the practice.

utterances.speaker: REPORTER
utterances.sentences: Right.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Welcome back, everyone. Let's head back to Morgan Freeman's blues clubs in Mississippi, where the party is going strong.Omar Jimenez, what's going on down there?

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Well, first of all, first of all, I am blocking two very important people right now. So I'm going to step out of the way because I got Mr. Morgan Freeman and Al Green with me. They are about to go on stage and perform together.Real quick. How are you guys feeling right now? You nervous?

utterances.speaker: FREEMAN
utterances.sentences: Huh?

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Says enough right there.How are you feeling, Al?

utterances.speaker: AL GREEN, MUSICIAN
utterances.sentences: Wonderful. Wonderful.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: All right. Look, I'm not going to hold them back anymore, so lets go on out to the stage. Let's show people what you all are made of. All right, here we go. We're walking out of the green room into the stage right here. Yeah, here we go, here we go. Walking out into the beautiful --

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Morgan Freeman, but I think for everyone here. Exactly.(CHEERS)

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: Hello. Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: We've got two legends here. The Reverend Al Green and a guy here that we'd all pay to see, read a phone book, the voice of god, Mr. Morgan Freeman. Enjoy.(MORGAN FREEMAN & AL GREEN PERFORMING)

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Whoa!

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: What a legend. Al Green.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I love it, I love it. That was so fun.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: The voice is still there. The smoothness of it, performance.And how about Morgan Freeman, Laura? Morgan Freeman hitting those high notes. I did not expect that.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I mean, he came in.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: That was incredible. Laura, thanks.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Look, he can do anything.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Seriously.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: That song made me feel so good. I loved it.Omar, thank you so much. Wow.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Shout out to Omar Jimenez as well.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: That made my year.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: That was so much fun to watch that. I cannot believe it. Isa, Boris, has been so fun.Omar, can we just talk about the fact that he was walking to legends behind him onto a stage to perform an iconic hit? What were you doing? What was the crowd doing when they were singing these great songs? I was over here loving it.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Look, yeah, that was the easiest part of the night, actually. All I had to do was sit back and enjoy music that I already know people enjoy all around the world.Honestly, the most nerve wracking part was we were standing back there in that green room and it was just the three of us standing there. And honestly, I wanted to stay out of their way. I was blocking them when the camera first came to us. And I almost was thinking to myself, why am I blocking these guys? Why am I even here right now? Because what we just saw was incredible. Incredible.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Omar --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I mean, Boris, can you imagine?

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: -- I have to ask you -- no. It's crazy. I mean, you're standing in front of two icons. I too would have been like, what am I doing here? But, Omar, I have to get your reaction to hearing Al Green himselfwith that voice, that iconic voice.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, man.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: It sounds like -- like silk. After all these years, he still sounds amazing.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I mean, I don't think that that Omar got the memo. Why is he working right now? What do you mean, you were working right now in the club? We're not working. We're just having fun.Isa?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Working, working, working.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, oh. Oh, okay. You know what? I missed the quotation marks. You're right about that.I see you, Omar Jimenez. I see you.

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: My mistake, I was trying to do some research. You know.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh, okay. All right, never mind. Okay. Great job, Omar.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Yeah, research, the all important research.Omar, we'll let you get back to more research in Clarksdale, Mississippi, at Ground Zero. Thank you so much, Omar, for that report. That iconic moment with Al Green.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I know. Boris, it has been an incredible, incredible day of fireworks, of food, dancing. We had all these costume changes by our friend Isa Soares as well. A lot, a lot of fun. Take a look back with me at some of the best moments of tonight.(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: BECKY ANDERSON, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.Can you see my jacket? You see what happened to the jacket? That is. That is the result of --

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Barbecue, yes.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: You do have a diaper in your survival kit. So, yes, I went and bought some diapers.(MUSIC)

utterances.speaker: STEPHANIE ELAM, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Here with me now. Come on in.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Ta-da!

utterances.speaker: JIMENEZ
utterances.sentences: So why don't you guys kick us off? You ready? Let's do it.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: What is this? What is this?

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Oh, this is my beautiful skirt. I'll give you a twirl. Oh, I've never had such a tiny waist in my life. I can't breathe.

utterances.speaker: FREEMAN
utterances.sentences: Hello, everybody. Happy New Year and all that. Welcome to Ground Zero blues club.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Merci.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Calves head.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Y'all hungry?

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Yeah. Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Yeah. Let's bring out the food. Bring it on out. We're going to have a party. A celebration.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Oh!

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: Senorita Laura.(FIREWORKS DISPLAY)

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: This might --

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I do!(MUSIC) (FIREWORKS) (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: We have had an incredible time sharing New Year's Eve with you around the world tonight. You had food. You had spectacle of light and sound, the fireworks. You had costumes. And I have to say, the MVP of the evening. When it comes to costumes is Isa Soares. I mean, Harry Potter, Ginger Spice, the Queen. That was intense. Mary Poppins.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Look at this, look at these, look at these.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Queen Elizabeth. Queen Elizabeth, Mary Poppins. Look at that. Harry Potter for you. Mary Poppins, apparently my kids' favorite outfit for the day.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: And you had Ginger Spice. Don't forget --

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Ginger Spice questioned the wig for a moment there.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Look, the wig --

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: We'll leave that aside for now.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: But you know what? You committed fully. And how proud were we of you, of all of it. And we had so much fun.I'm so glad to be here with you. I'll never forget it.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: So glad you came on board. And glad. And guess what, everyone.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Up next, it will be me and Boris as dancing with the stars. I'm kidding.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Give him a ring. Give him a ring. They've got potential.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: Don't call us. We'll call you.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I'm not against it. I'm not against it. I -- well, well, I just got to get that spin down. I still haven't been able to figure that out, but we have some new challenges, possibly for next year.We saw that that samba sort of thing that Julia Vargas was doing. We saw folks down here doing the cancan. I don't know, Laura, are you up for the challenge?

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I don't tell you about it. All I know is it was great.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: I saw your salsa feet. You got some good salsa feet on you.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I have good feet. I have good feet. But you know what I don't have? I don't have the stomach to eat whatever it is you ate, Boris. Whatever it is you ate, Boris, I'm telling you, there is like a Kaopectate in your future, my friend.

utterances.speaker: SOARES
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: COATES
utterances.sentences: I don't know what to tell you.

utterances.speaker: SANCHEZ
utterances.sentences: I don't know, I don't know if there's a relationship between all that weird stuff that I ate with Saskya Vandoorne and how ill I felt a few hours before we went on the air. Again, shout out to that vaping doctor that hooked me up with allthese prescriptions, because I feel pretty good. I think it went pretty well. I got to say. (MUSIC)
